data.name: Pergedel
data.description: Fried potato cakes mixed with ground meat, often served as a side dish or snack.

data.name: Tempeh Goreng
data.description: Fried tempeh, a traditional Indonesian soy product, often served with sambal or as a side dish.

data.name: Sambal
data.description: A spicy chili paste or sauce, commonly served as a condiment or side dish to accompany various meals.

data.name: Acar
data.description: Pickled vegetables such as carrots, cucumbers, and cabbage, often served alongside grilled meats or rice dishes.

data.name: Kerupuk
data.description: Crispy crackers made from fish or shrimp, commonly served as a side snack or accompaniment to rice dishes.

data.name: Tahu Tempe Bacem
data.description: Tempeh and tofu cooked in sweet soy sauce and spices, then deep-fried to create a savory, sweet side dish.

data.name: Sayur Asem
data.description: A sour vegetable soup made with tamarind, peanuts, and a variety of fresh vegetables.

data.name: Lalapan
data.description: A simple side dish consisting of raw vegetables like cucumber, lettuce, and basil, usually served with sambal.

data.name: Nasi Uduk
data.description: Fragrant rice cooked in coconut milk, often served with fried chicken, omelets, or sambal.

data.name: Gurame Goreng
data.description: Crispy fried gourami fish, often served with sambal and a side of rice.
